summary.span: Represents the data from PKCS#12 PFX contents.

span.span: Represents the data from PKCS#12 PFX contents.
This class cannot be inherited.

param.span: The data to interpret as a PKCS#12 PFX.

span.span: The data to interpret as a PKCS#12 PFX.

span.span: When this method returns, contains a value that indicates the number of bytes from which were read by this method.

param.span: to store without making a defensive copy; otherwise, .

The default is .

summary.span: Reads the provided data as a PKCS#12 PFX and returns an object view of the contents.

span.span: Reads the provided data as a PKCS#12 PFX and returns an object view of the contents.

returns.span: An object view of the PKCS#12 PFX decoded from the input.

span.span: An object view of the PKCS#12 PFX decoded from the input.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Das Standardverhalten dieser Methode besteht darin, eine defensive Kopie der ersten `bytesConsumed` Bytes aus `encodedBytes`zu erstellen.The default behavior of this method is to make a defensive copy of the first `bytesConsumed` bytes from `encodedBytes`. Wenn der `skipCopy`-Parameter `true`ist, wird diese Defensive Kopie übersprungen.When the `skipCopy` parameter is `true`, this defensive copy is skipped. Wenn die Defensive Kopie übersprungen wird und sich der Inhalt der ersten `bytesConsumed` Bytes `encodedBytes` während der Lebensdauer des zurückgegebenen Werts oder eines Objekts ändert, das von seinen Methoden oder Eigenschaften erzeugt wird, können Methoden und Eigenschaften für diese Objekte zu einem Unsinn führen. Ergebnisse oder Auslösen von Ausnahmen aufgrund des beschädigten Zustands.If the defensive copy is skipped and the contents of the first `bytesConsumed` bytes of `encodedBytes` change during the lifetime of the returned value or of any object produced by its methods or properties, then methods and properties on those objects may produce nonsense results or throw exceptions due to the corrupted state. Bei Aufrufern wird daher empfohlen, nur einen `true` Wert für den Parameter `skipCopy` zu verwenden, wenn Sie sicher sein können, dass die Daten intakt bleiben.Callers are therefore advised to only use a `true` value for the `skipCopy` parameter when they can be reasonably assured that the data will stay intact.

exception.span: The contents of the parameter were not successfully decoded as a PKCS#12 PFX.

span.span: The contents of the parameter were not successfully decoded as a PKCS#12 PFX.

span.span: One of the enumeration members that indicates the type of tamper protection provided for the contents.

summary.span: Attempts to verify the integrity of the contents with a password.

span.span: Attempts to verify the integrity of the contents with a password.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Es ist nicht möglich, den Fehler zu unterscheiden, weil das Kennwort aufgrund der Änderung des Inhalts nicht korrekt ist.It's not possible to distinguish the error due to the password being incorrect from the error due to the contents having been altered. Es ist in der Regel der Fall, dass eine Kenn Wort geschützte PFX-Datei das gleiche Kennwort für den Mac-Algorithmus verwendet, der die Integrität und den Verschlüsselungsalgorithmus bereitstellt.It's usually the case that a password-protected PFX uses the same password for the MAC algorithm providing integrity and the encryption algorithm providing confidentiality, but the file format doesn't make that a requirement. Daher gibt es keine Garantie dafür, dass ein Kennwort, das zu einer `true`, die von dieser Methode zurückgegeben wird, bei einem aufgerufen wird.Therefore, there is no guarantee that a password which results in a `true` return from this method will succeed on a call to .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool VerifyMac(valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<char> password) cil managed
Public Function VerifyMac (password As ReadOnlySpan(Of Char)) As Boolean

param.name: password
param.span: The password to use to attempt to verify integrity.

span.span: The password to use to attempt to verify integrity.

summary.span: Attempts to verify the integrity of the contents with a password represented by a System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char}.

span.span: Attempts to verify the integrity of the contents with a password represented by a System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char}.

returns.span: if the password successfully verifies the integrity of the contents; if the password is not correct or the contents have been altered.

span.span: if the password successfully verifies the integrity of the contents; if the password is not correct or the contents have been altered.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In der PKCS # 12-Spezifikation wird ein Unterschied zwischen einem `null` Kennwort und einem "leeren" Kennwort getroffen, und dieser Unterschied wird im Rückgabewert dieser Methode widergespiegelt.In the PKCS#12 specification, a distinction is made between a `null` password and an "empty" password, and that difference is reflected in the return value of this method. `ReadOnlySpan.Empty` das `null` Kennwort darstellt und `String.Empty.AsSpan()` das "leere" Kennwort darstellt.`ReadOnlySpan.Empty` represents the `null` password and `String.Empty.AsSpan()` represents the "empty" password. Wenn einer dieser beiden Werte `true`zurückgibt, ist das andere nicht.If one of those two values returns `true`, the other won't.

span.span: The value is not .

exception.span: The hash algorithm option specified by the PKCS#12 PFX contents could not be identified or is not supported by this platform.

span.span: The hash algorithm option specified by the PKCS#12 PFX contents could not be identified or is not supported by this platform.

span.span: if the password successfully verifies the integrity of the contents; if the password is not correct or the contents have been altered.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In der PKCS # 12-Spezifikation wird ein Unterschied zwischen einem `null` Kennwort und einem "leeren" Kennwort getroffen, und dieser Unterschied wird im Rückgabewert dieser Methode widergespiegelt.In the PKCS#12 specification, a distinction is made between a `null` password and an "empty" password, and that difference is reflected in the return value of this method. Wenn die `null` Zeichenfolge `true`zurückgibt, gibt `false`zurück und umgekehrt.If the `null` string returns `true`, then returns `false`, and vice versa.
